displaytitle: Untitled VI, from the series Convites de Casamento

titles.title: Untitled VI, from the series Convites de Casamento

makers.displaydate: born 1948, Caetanópolis, Brazil; active São Paulo, and Belo Horizonte, Brazil
makers.displaymaker: Sonia Gomes, born 1948, Caetanópolis, Brazil; active São Paulo, and Belo Horizonte, Brazil

texts.textentryhtml:
The artist; [Mendes Wood DM Gallery, Sao Paolo]; purchased by Shamus Khan, 2020; gifted
to the Princeton University Art Museum, 2024.
texts.remarks: Purchase price in 2020: $15,000. Purchase information (gallery/price) reported by Khan.

texts.textentryhtml:
“I am a Black woman working from a
peripherical context, and this, of course,
informed my working opportunities,
methods and ethics. But it is not all; it
does not define me. My work saved me;
the committed—compulsive even—labour
of mending, unknotting, sewing and
wrapping existing materials is what keeps
me grounded and going.”

Gomes’s mixed-media works interweave themes of craft and gender with different Afro-Brazilian traditions, often incorporating secondhand textiles to evoke the power of memory as well as the environmental consequences of global consumption and waste. In this work, Gomes combines fabrics and string with drawn lines to create dynamic forms that recall the curling movement of vines. The textured surface of the debossed paper—with an imprinted design that creates an indented effect—enhances the three-dimensionality of the work.

displaymaker: Sonia Gomes, born 1948, Caetanópolis, Brazil; active São Paulo, and Belo Horizonte, Brazil
caption: Sonia Gomes (born 1948, Caetanópolis, Brazil; active São Paulo, and Belo Horizonte, Brazil), Untitled VI, from the series Convites de Casamento, 2017. Mixed media on debossed paper; 54.5 × 42.4 × 7 cm (frame). Gift of Shamus R. Khan (2024-522)
